greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer solutions to the equation 2x^2+y^2+8z^2=m for an odd number m=2n-1.
comment: Related to primitive congruent numbers A006991.
Assuming the Birch and Swinnerton-Dyer conjecture, the odd number 2n-1 is a congruent number if it is squarefree and a(n) = 2*A072069(n).
Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
Clay Mathematics Institute, The Birch and Swinnerton-Dyer Conjecture
Department of Pure Maths., Univ. Sheffield, Pythagorean triples and the congruent number problem
Karl Rubin, Elliptic curves and right triangles
J. B. Tunnell, A classical Diophantine problem and modular forms of weight 3/2, Invent. Math., 72 (1983), 323-334.
formula: Expansion of 2 * x * phi(x) * psi(x^4) * phi(x^4) in powers of x where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 08 2012
Expansion of 2 * q^(1/2) * eta(q^2)^5 * eta(q^8)^7 / (eta(q)^2 * eta(q^4)^5 * eta(q^16)^2) in powers of q. - _Michael Somos_, Feb 19 2015
example: a(2) = 4 because (1,1,0), (-1,1,0), (1,-1,0) and (-1,-1,0) are solutions when m=3.
mathematica: maxN=128; soln1=Table[0, {maxN/2}]; xMax=Ceiling[Sqrt[maxN/2]]; yMax=Ceiling[Sqrt[maxN]]; zMax=Ceiling[Sqrt[maxN/8]]; Do[n=2x^2+y^2+8z^2; If[OddQ[n]&&n<maxN, s=8; If[x==0, s=s/2]; If[y==0, s=s/2]; If[z==0, s=s/2]; soln1[[(n+1)/2]]+=s], {x, 0, xMax}, {y, 0, yMax}, {z, 0, zMax}]
A072068 = CoefficientList[s, x] // Rest (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 16 2015, after _Michael Somos_ *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); n--; if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( 2 * eta(x^2 + A)^5 * eta(x^8 + A)^7 / (eta(x + A)^2 * eta(x^4 + A)^5 * eta(x^16 + A)^2), n))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Dec 26 2019 */
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Jun 13 2002
